discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
TOGAF® Series Guide: A Practitioners’ Approach to Developing Enterprise Architecture Following the TOGAF® ADM (https://pubs.opengroup.org/togaf-standard/adm-practitioners/adm-practitioners_5.html)
paragraph 5.2.2 table 4

A: Phase B: Business Architecture,Phase C: Information Systems Architectures, & Phase D: Technology Architecture

A set of domain architectures approved by the stakeholders for the problem being addressed, with a set of gaps, and work to clear the gaps understood by the stakeholders.

Selected Answer: A
as per book it should be in BCD

Selected Answer: C
Stakeholder approval is sought for the proposed set of projects or work packages that will bridge these gaps, which is a crucial outcome of Phase E.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct as per the notes from Open group documentation

choices.A: А-Corporate Capability, В-Portfolio Capability, С-Project Capability
choices.D: A-Architecture Vision, B-Business Architecture, С-Architecture Development
choices.C: А-Enterprise Strategic Architecture, В-Segment Architecture, C-Capability Architecture
choices.B: А-Strategy Architecture, В-Tactic Architecture, С-Operational Architecture

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
as per togaf

Selected Answer: C
TOGAF® Fundamental Content => Architecture Development Method (ADM) => 3. Phase A: Architecture Vision => paragraph 3.3.8
https://pubs.opengroup.org/togaf-standard/adm/chap03.html#tag_03_03_08
3.3.8

questions.question_text: What does the TOGAF ADM recommend for use in developing an Architecture Vision document?

choices.D: A classification mechanism for architectures and solutions
choices.B: A method for developing an organization-specific enterprise architecture
choices.A: A process for managing and controlling change at an enterprise-wide level
choices.C: A process for managing architecture requirements

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://pubs.opengroup.org/pocket-guides/togaf-pocket-guide/main/chap06.html#:~:text=the%20ADM%20phases.-,What%20is%20the%20ADM?,is%20illustrated%20in%20Figure%201. What is the ADM?
The ADM provides a tested and repeatable process for developing architectures. It is a method for deriving organization-specific Enterprise Architectures and is specifically designed to address business requirements.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the TOGAF Architecture Development Method?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Architecture Content document chapter 5.3.2 Figure 5-1: Associate building block gaps with work packages that will address the gaps

questions.question_text: In which part of the ADM cycle do building block gaps become associated with work packages that will address the gaps?
